question:
Recently, the National Investment and Infrastructure Fund (NIIF) has partnered with DP World to create an investment platform for logistics businesses in India. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. NIIF is India’s first sovereign wealth fund and this investment is NIIF’s first investment
  2. The NIIF is being operationalised by establishing three Alternative Investment Funds (AIFs) under the RBI regulations
  3. GOI’s contribution to the AIFs under the NIIF scheme will be up to 51 percent of the total commitment
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is correct</u>. NIIF is India’s first sovereign wealth fund and this investment is NIIF’s first investment. DP World partnership with NIIF follows the memorandum of understanding (MoU) that was signed in May 2017 after the visit of the Abu Dhabi's Crown Prince Sheikh Mohammed bin Zayed Al Nahyan and DP World Group Chairman and CEO Sultan Ahmed bin Sulayem to India in February 2016. <u>Second statement is incorrect</u>. The NIIF is being operationalised by establishing three Alternative Investment Funds (AIFs) under the Sebi Regulations. <u>Third statement is incorrect</u>. GOI’s contribution to the AIFs under the NIIF scheme shall be 49 percent of the total commitment.
